title: 1940's Poster typeface?
content:
Hi Guys,

I need to generate something similar to the poster attached - looking for a display face that would be a good base to work with... Any ideas?

Thanks!  
A.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007082940im_/http:/typophile.com/files/photo_6210.JPG)
author: anniemack

comments.content:
Fairly heavy condensed thick and thin lettering with distinctive terminals, and a clean casual but not sloppy flavor.  
Not a lot of digital substitutes.  
Part way there:  
 Valjean [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/valjean/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007082940/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/valjean/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/valjean/")  
Emerge BF [An old design called Admiral]  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bomparte/emerge/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007082940/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bomparte/emerge/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bomparte/emerge/")  
PAG Club  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/prop-a-ganda/pag-club/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007082940/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/prop-a-ganda/pag-club/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/prop-a-ganda/pag-club/")  
PAG Bankas [not condensed]  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/prop-a-ganda/pag-bankas/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007082940/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/prop-a-ganda/pag-bankas/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/prop-a-ganda/pag-bankas/")  
Don

Two which share some trait/feel with the sample:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/deniserebryakov/oldsman-no-1/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007082940/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/deniserebryakov/oldsman-no-1/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/deniserebryakov/oldsman-no-1/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/p22/vienna/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007082940/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/p22/vienna/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/p22/vienna/")

On the other hand, you could start with a condensed (or a combination of condensed and non-condensed) high-contrast sans like Radiant and recreate the quirkiest letters.

This is a cool poster. (Thanks Riccardo for bringing it to my attention.)

Would it be possible to post this on Flickr? I'd love to be able to add it to this group:  
 [https://www.flickr.com/groups/altcontrast/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007082940/https:/www.flickr.com/groups/altcontrast/ "https://www.flickr.com/groups/altcontrast/")

hhp
YES OF COURSE! PLEASE DO! Share the love!

Might be interesting to try and identify the person who did the poster lettering in 1940.  
\_VÅRUTSTÄLLNINGEN I NATIONALMUSEUM KONST KONSTANTVERK\_ seems to be Swedish for \_SPRING EXHIBITION IN THE NATIONAL MUSEUM CONSTANT ART WORKS\_ A place to start might be the museum's website [http://www.nationalmuseum.se/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007082940/http:/www.nationalmuseum.se/ "http://www.nationalmuseum.se/")  
Don

That's "konsthantverk", crafts. As in

SPRING EXHIBITION AT THE NATIONAL MUSEUM  
ARTS  
CRAFTS

Unfortunately the museum library is closed for renovation at the moment, or I could have swung by to have a look.

Thanks Johan for the better translation than I was able to drag out of Google translate. I was puzzled by "constant art" but I couldn't figure out what it meant.  
Don
It's fun what a single letter can do sometimes! :) I'd like to see the Constant Works at some point.

Could be quite an exhibition. Consider some possibilities. The constants of the universe: Pi, the speed of light, the Boltzman constant etc. Others could include???  
Don
A ratio of spam to legitimate posts on forums?

K=spam\>legitimate posts but is there a # for K.  
Don
I'm thinking artworks that are never finished, but are constantly being worked on. Possibly by automation, or nature.

I had he same idea with Johan: Artworks in a "Work-In-Progress" state.  
I can even imaging an exhibition room having multiple copies (sculptures, paintings) of the same artwork at different construction stages.  
Even better: The "last-stage" artwork could be such that you can jump again to the first one and continue in circles :)
